factoid: Natásha said in a whisper that when someone keeps recalling memories, they eventually remember what happened before they were in the world.
Sónya said that it is metempsychosis.
Sónya had always learned well.
Sónya remembered everything.
The Egyptians believed that our souls have lived in animals.
The Egyptians believed that our souls will go back into animals again.
Natásha said that she does not believe the group ever were in animals.
Natásha said that she is certain that the group were angels somewhere, and have been here, and that is why the group remember.
The music had ceased.
Dimmler said that he may join them.
Dimmler had come up quietly.
Dimmler sat down by them.
Nicholas said that if the group has been angels, why has the group fallen lower.
Nicholas said that that can't be.
Natásha said that not lower, who said the group were lower.
Natásha said that she does not know what she was before.
The soul is immortal.
If Natásha shall always live, Natásha must have lived before.
If Natásha shall always live, Natásha must have lived for a whole eternity.
Dimmler remarked that it is hard for the group to imagine eternity.
Dimmler had joined the young folk with a mildly condescending smile.
Dimmler now spoke as quietly and seriously as the group.
Natásha asked why it is hard to imagine eternity.
Natásha said that it is now today.
Natásha said that it will be tomorrow.
Natásha said that it is always.
Natásha said that there was yesterday.
Natásha said that there was the day before.
The countess said that Natásha, now it's your turn, sing me something.
The countess asked why the group is sitting there like conspirators.
Natásha replied that she does not want to.
Natásha rose.
None of them wanted to break off their conversation and quit that corner in the sitting room.
The middle-aged Dimmler did not want to break off conversation.
Natásha got up.
Nicholas sat down at the clavichord.
Natásha stood as usual in the middle of the hall.
Natásha chose the place where the resonance was best.
Natásha began to sing her mother's favorite song.
Natásha had said she did not want to sing.
Natásha had sung long before.
Natásha sang again that evening.
The count was in his study where he was talking to Mítenka.
The count heard Natásha.
The count blundered in his talk while giving orders to the steward.
The count at last stopped.
Mítenka stood in front of the count, listening and smiling.
Nicholas did not take his eyes off his sister.
Nicholas drew breath in time with his sister.
Sónya listened.
Sónya thought of the immense difference between herself and her friend.
Sónya thought how impossible it was to be anything as bewitching as her cousin.
The old countess sat with a blissful yet sad smile.
The old countess had tears in her eyes.
The old countess occasionally shook her head.
The old countess thought of Natásha.
The old countess thought of her own youth.
The old countess thought that there was something unnatural and dreadful in the impending marriage of Natásha and Prince Andrew.
Dimmler had seated himself beside the countess.
Dimmler listened with closed eyes.
Dimmler said that the Countess is a European talent.
Dimmler said that she has nothing to learn.
Dimmler said that she has softness, tenderness, and strength.
The countess said that she is afraid for her.
The countess said that she is afraid.
The countess did not realize to whom she was speaking.
The countess's maternal instinct told her that Natásha had too much of something.
The countess's maternal instinct told her that because of this Natásha would not be happy.
Before Natásha had finished singing, fourteen-year-old Pétya rushed in delightedly.
Pétya said that some mummers had arrived.
Natásha stopped abruptly.
Natásha screamed at her brother that he was an idiot.
Natásha ran to a chair.
Natásha threw herself on the chair.
Natásha sobbed so violently that she could not stop for a long time.
Natásha said that it's nothing, Mamma, really it's nothing.
Natásha said that only Pétya startled her.
Natásha tried to smile.
Natásha's tears still flow.
Natásha's sobs still choked her.
